description: The round payoff this round was 4. You, John chose to play option 2.Kate chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -4000.

The game sets up a high-risk, high-reward scenario: if one player deviates from the safe default (option 1) while the other sticks with it, the deviator gains the round input—but if both deviate, the penalty (round input × 1000) is severe.

Both players’ default action is option 1, which leads to a safe outcome of 0. Deviating from this default is only beneficial if the opponent sticks with their default; otherwise, it incurs a catastrophic cost.

The memory from 2024-01-02 shows that when John chose option 2, Kate also chose option 2—resulting in a payoff of –4000 for John. This illustrates the high risk of deviating when the opponent unexpectedly deviates as well (even if the opponent’s default is option 1).
